name: Free Actions
title: Free Actions
text: Any item, ability, or command with <yellow>yellow</> text doesn't end a player unit's turn{br}They can even attack afterwards!

name: Caps
title: Stat Caps
text: HP: <yellow-green>20</> for T1, <yellow-green>25</> for T2{br}All Others: <yellow-green>10</>{br}All Units have <yellow-green>MOV</> Growths!

name: Stat Colors
title: Stat Colors
text: As characters gain stats through level ups, the color of the stat changes:{br}<orange>Orange: Base</>{br}<yellow>Yellow: +1</>{br}<yellow-green>Green: +2</>{br}<blue>Blue: +3</>{br}<purple>Purple >3</>

name: Equations
title: Equations
text: <purple>Hit</>: <yellow>SKL</>*<blue>20</> + <yellow>LCK</>*<blue>5</>{br}<purple>Avo</>: <yellow>SPD</>*<blue>5</> + <yellow>LCK</>*<blue>5</>{br}<purple>Crit Avo</>: <yellow>LCK</>*<blue>10</>{br}<purple>Doubling Threshold</>: <blue>1</> <yellow>SPD</>{br}<purple>Crit Damage</>: <blue>x2</>{br}<purple>Effectiveness</>: <blue>x3</>

name: Rescuing
title: Rescuing
text: Rescuing a unit normally incurs a <red>-1 SPD</>/<red>SKL</> penalty{br}However, these penalties are waived when a <blue>Trainee</> unit is rescued by a <blue>Non-Trainee</> unit{br}Units can act after rescuing or any other associated action

name: Wep. Triangle
title: Weapon Triangle
text: <purple>Advantage</>:{br}<blue>+1</> <yellow>Mt</> / <blue>+10</> <yellow>Hit</>{br}<purple>Disadvantage</>:{br}<light-orange>-1</> <yellow>Mt</> / <light-orange>-10</> <yellow>Hit</>

name: Wep. Ranks
title: Weapon Ranks
text: Most weapons don't require weapon ranks. Instead, characters gain Hit at rank A and S:{br}{br}A Rank: <yellow-green>+10 Hit</>{br}S Rank: <yellow-green>+20 Hit</>

name: Convoy
title: Convoy
text: The <green>Convoy</> works differently depending on the difficulty:{br}{br}<yellow>Normal</>: Player unit inventory goes to <green>Convoy</> on death{br}<orange>Hard</>: They do not{br}<red>Lunatic</>: There is <red>no Convoy</>...

name: Building
title: Building Supports
text:
Units can support with any other playable unit but are limited to <yellow-green>1 support partner</> at a time{br}Supports are unlocked after a chapter where both units are deployed
Each pair only has 1 support rank{br}If either unit <red-orange>dies</>, the support is <red-orange>broken</>; allowing the surviving unit to support with a different unit

name: Bonuses
title: Support Bonuses
text:
Units gain a bonus based on their partner's affinity while <blue>within 3 tiles</> of each other:
<purple>Fire</>: <blue>+2</> <yellow>STR</>/<yellow>MAG</>{br}<purple>Wind</>:<blue> +2</> <yellow>SPD</>{br}<purple>Ice</>: <blue>+2</> <yellow>DEF</>/<yellow>RES</>{br}<purple>Thunder</>: <blue>+30</> <yellow>Crit</>{br}<purple>Light</>: <blue>+30</> <yellow>Avoid</>{br}<purple>Dark</>: <blue>+30</> <yellow>Hit</>

name: General
title: General
text:
On <red>Hard</red>:{br}Inventories don't go to{br}convoy <red>on death</red>.{br}Prf weapons have <red>less</red> uses{br}Blessed weapons are <red>S Rank</red>{br}Enemies have higher growths
On <red>Lunatic</red>:{br}There is <red>no convoy</red>{br}There are <red>less</red> droppables{br}Some enemies have edited{br}inventories{br}Enemies have even higher growths and higher defences

name: Ch1
title: Chapter 1
text: On <red>Hard</red> you have <red>8 turns</red>{br}to escape

name: Ch2
title: Chapter 2
text: On <red>Hard</red> you have <red>10 turns</red>{br}to clear{br}{br}On <red>Lunatic</red> vision granted{br}from doors is <red>removed</red>

name: Ch3
title: Chapter 3
text: On <red>Hard</red> you have to{br}survive for <red>7 turns</red>{br}{br}On <red>Lunatic</red> any item pilfered{br}by thieves <red>disappears</red>

name: Ch4
title: Chapter 4
text: On <red>Hard</red> Cawthorne{br}arrives <red>earlier</red>{br}{br}On <red>Lunatic</red> any item pilfered{br}by thieves <red>disappears</red>

name: Ch5
title: Chapter 5
text: On <red>Hard</red> Cawthorne has a <red>Second Stage</red>; He and his{br}lieutenants <red>charge earlier</red>{br}{br}On <red>Lunatic</red> Shallcross and Keeva also <red>charge</red>

name: Modes
title: Bonus Modes
text:
<blue>Weapon Reversal</blue> Modes:{br}You can select <blue>WR</blue>/<blue>DR</blue> for player units and enemy units independently{br}<blue>Reverse Recruitment</blue> Mode is also independent!{br}Customize your playthrough!
<blue>PRF Weapons</blue> change accordingly for player <blue>WR</blue>/<blue>DR</blue>{br}Droppable weapons also change accordingly for enemy <blue>WR</blue>/<blue>DR</blue>

name: W.Reversal
title: Weapon Reversal
text: In <blue>Weapon Reversal</blue> Mode:{br}Units change classes to one that has weapon triangle advantage over their original class{br}Bow units become staffers and vice versa

name: D.Reversal
title: Double Reversal
text: In <blue>Double Reversal</blue> Mode:{br}Units change classes to one that their original class has weapon triangle advantage over{br}Bow and staff units retain their original classes

name: R.Recruitment
title: Reverse Recruitment
text:
In <blue>Reverse Recruitment</blue> mode player units are recruited in <red>reverse</red> order.{br}Player units are autoleveled accordingly{br}Their houses are even reversed accordingly!
For the purposes of events:{br}<blue>Elspeth</blue> replaces <blue>Elwynn</blue>{br}<blue>Quinley</blue> replaces <blue>Lamonte</blue>, and <blue>Saraid</blue> replaces <blue>Garvey</blue>{br}<blue>Alpin</blue> replaces <blue>Laisren</blue> as the <red>Gotoh</red>

name: Thrall Visits
title: Thrall Visits
text:
When a <blue>Thrall</> visits a house <blue>Quinley</> acquires a powerful consumable instead of triggering the regular visit
Thralls can visit any house, and these count as <red>generic visits</> for the <green>Instructions Unclear</> Achievement
<blue>Soul Rend</> removes all skills on an adjacent enemy, leaving them vulnerable!

name: Burning
title: Burning
text: <blue>Saraid</>'s Firestarter sets tiles ablaze with holy fire!{br}The fire spreads next turn to adjacent tiles{br}<red>Enemy Units</> who are on fire at take 4 damage on their turn{br}Also, they suffer -1 SKL/SPD/DEF/RES

name: Visiting
title: Visiting
text:
Houses are labeled by which unit lives there{semicolon}{br}They or somebody close to them may have a unique experience when visiting
Visit tiles will highlight upon unit select if they have a unique visit

name: Thieves
title: Thieves
text: Thieves <red>will never interact with player units</red>{br}{br}They just want to get loot, then get out!
